Table of Contents

Class TextFlowContainer

Namespace
osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers
Assembly
osu.Framework.dll

A drawable text object that supports more advanced text formatting.

public class TextFlowContainer : FillFlowContainer, IDependencyInjectionCandidate, IDisposable, IContainerEnumerable<Drawable>, IContainerCollection<Drawable>, IContainer, IDrawable, ICollection<Drawable>, IReadOnlyList<Drawable>, IReadOnlyCollection<Drawable>, IEnumerable<Drawable>, IEnumerable, IFillFlowContainer, ITransformable, ISourceGeneratedHandleInputCache, ISourceGeneratedDependencyActivator, ISourceGeneratedLongRunningLoadCache

public TextFlowContainer(Action<SpriteText> defaultCreationParameters = null)

Parameters

defaultCreationParameters Action<SpriteText>

Properties

ContentIndent

An indent value for all lines proceeding the first line in a paragraph.

public float ContentIndent { get; set; }

Property Value

float

FirstLineIndent

An indent value for the first (header) line of a paragraph.

public float FirstLineIndent { get; set; }

Property Value

float

FlowingChildren

Gets the children that appear in the flow of this FlowContainer<T> in the order in which they are processed within the flowing layout.

public override IEnumerable<Drawable> FlowingChildren { get; }

Property Value

IEnumerable<Drawable>

LineSpacing

Vertical space between lines both when a new paragraph begins and when line wrapping occurs. Additive with ParagraphSpacing on new paragraph. Default value is 0.

public float LineSpacing { get; set; }

Property Value

float

ParagraphSpacing

Vertical space between paragraphs (i.e. text separated by '\n') in multiples of the text size. The default value is 0.5.

public float ParagraphSpacing { get; set; }

Property Value

float

Text

An easy way to set the full text of a text flow in one go. This will overwrite any existing text added using this method of AddText(LocalisableString, Action<SpriteText>)

public LocalisableString Text { set; }

Property Value

LocalisableString

TextAnchor

The Anchor which text should flow from.

public Anchor TextAnchor { get; set; }

Property Value

Anchor

Methods

Add(Drawable)

Adds a child to this container. This amounts to adding a child to Content's Children, recursing until Content == this.

public override void Add(Drawable drawable)

Parameters

drawable Drawable

AddParagraph(LocalisableString, Action<SpriteText>)

Add a new paragraph to this text flow. The \n character will create a line break If you need \n to be a new paragraph, not just a line break, use AddText<TSpriteText>(LocalisableString, Action<TSpriteText>) instead.

public ITextPart AddParagraph(LocalisableString paragraph, Action<SpriteText> creationParameters = null)

Parameters

paragraph LocalisableString

The paragraph to add.

creationParameters Action<SpriteText>

A callback providing any SpriteText instances created for this new paragraph.

Returns

ITextPart

A collection of Drawable objects for each SpriteText word and TextFlowContainer.NewLineContainer created from the given text.

AddParagraph<TSpriteText>(LocalisableString, Action<TSpriteText>)

Add a new paragraph to this text flow. The \n character will create a line break If you need \n to be a new paragraph, not just a line break, use AddText<TSpriteText>(LocalisableString, Action<TSpriteText>) instead.

public ITextPart AddParagraph<TSpriteText>(LocalisableString paragraph, Action<TSpriteText> creationParameters = null) where TSpriteText : SpriteText, new()

Parameters

paragraph LocalisableString

The paragraph to add.

creationParameters Action<TSpriteText>

A callback providing any SpriteText instances created for this new paragraph.

Returns

ITextPart

A collection of Drawable objects for each SpriteText word and TextFlowContainer.NewLineContainer created from the given text.

Type Parameters

TSpriteText

AddPart(ITextPart)

Adds an ITextPart and its associated drawables to this TextFlowContainer.

protected ITextPart AddPart(ITextPart part)

Parameters

part ITextPart

Returns

ITextPart

AddText(LocalisableString, Action<SpriteText>)

Add new text to this text flow. The \n character will create a new paragraph, not just a line break. If you need \n to be a line break, use AddParagraph<TSpriteText>(LocalisableString, Action<TSpriteText>) instead.

public ITextPart AddText(LocalisableString text, Action<SpriteText> creationParameters = null)

Parameters

text LocalisableString

The text to add.

creationParameters Action<SpriteText>

A callback providing any SpriteText instances created for this new text.

Returns

ITextPart

A collection of Drawable objects for each SpriteText word and TextFlowContainer.NewLineContainer created from the given text.

AddText<TSpriteText>(TSpriteText, Action<TSpriteText>)

Add an arbitrary SpriteText to this TextFlowContainer. While default creation parameters are applied automatically, word wrapping is unavailable for contained words. This should only be used when a specialised SpriteText type is required.

public void AddText<TSpriteText>(TSpriteText text, Action<TSpriteText> creationParameters = null) where TSpriteText : SpriteText

Parameters

text TSpriteText

The text to add.

creationParameters Action<TSpriteText>

A callback providing any SpriteText instances created for this new text.

Type Parameters

TSpriteText

AddText<TSpriteText>(LocalisableString, Action<TSpriteText>)

Add new text to this text flow. The \n character will create a new paragraph, not just a line break. If you need \n to be a line break, use AddParagraph<TSpriteText>(LocalisableString, Action<TSpriteText>) instead.

public ITextPart AddText<TSpriteText>(LocalisableString text, Action<TSpriteText> creationParameters = null) where TSpriteText : SpriteText, new()

Parameters

text LocalisableString

The text to add.

creationParameters Action<TSpriteText>

A callback providing any SpriteText instances created for this new text.

Returns

ITextPart

A collection of Drawable objects for each SpriteText word and TextFlowContainer.NewLineContainer created from the given text.

Clear(bool)

Removes all children.

public override void Clear(bool disposeChildren)

Parameters

disposeChildren bool

Whether removed children should also get disposed. Disposal will be recursive.

Compares two InternalChildren to determine their sorting.

protected override int Compare(Drawable x, Drawable y)

Parameters

x Drawable

The first child to compare.

y Drawable

The second child to compare.

Returns

int

-1 if x comes before y, and 1 otherwise.

ForceNewRow(Drawable)

Returns true if the given child should be placed on a new row, false otherwise. This will be called automatically for each child in this FillFlowContainers FlowingChildren-List.

protected override bool ForceNewRow(Drawable child)

Parameters

child Drawable

The child to check.

Returns

bool

True if the given child should be placed on a new row, false otherwise.

InvalidateLayout()

Invoked when layout should be invalidated.

protected override void InvalidateLayout()

LoadAsyncComplete()

Invoked after dependency injection has completed for this Drawable and all children if this is a CompositeDrawable.

protected override void LoadAsyncComplete()

Remarks

This method is invoked in the potentially asynchronous context of Load(IFrameBasedClock, IReadOnlyDependencyContainer, bool) prior to this Drawable becoming IsLoaded = true.

LoadComplete()

Invoked after this Drawable has finished loading.

protected override void LoadComplete()

Remarks

This method is invoked on the update thread inside this Drawable's UpdateSubTree().

NewLine()

End current line and start a new one.

public void NewLine()

NewParagraph()

End current paragraph and start a new one.

public void NewParagraph()

RemovePart(ITextPart)

Removes an ITextPart from this text flow.

public bool RemovePart(ITextPart partToRemove)

Parameters

partToRemove ITextPart

Returns

bool

Whether ITextPart was successfully removed from the flow.

Update()

Performs a once-per-frame update specific to this Drawable. A more elegant alternative to OnUpdate when deriving from Drawable. Note, that this method is always called before Drawables further down the scene graph are updated.

protected override void Update()

UpdateAfterChildren()

An opportunity to update state once-per-frame after Update() has been called for all InternalChildren. This is invoked prior to any autosize calculations of this CompositeDrawable.

protected override void UpdateAfterChildren()
